slides.title: Causes
bullets: Treaty of Versailles
Rise of fascism in Germany, Italy, Japan
Global depression
Appeasement of Hitler
Failure of the League of Nations

slides.title: Main Powers
bullets: Allied Powers: Britain, France, Soviet Union (joined 1941), United States (joined 1941), China
Axis Powers: Germany, Italy, Japan

slides.title: Major Events
bullets: 1939: Germany invades Poland; WWII begins
1940: Fall of France; Battle of Britain
1941: Operation Barbarossa (Germany invades USSR); Pearl Harbor attack brings US into war
1942–43: Turning points with battles like Stalingrad (USSR), Midway (Pacific)
1944: D-Day (Allied invasion of Normandy, France)
1945: Germany surrenders (May); atomic bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki; Japan surrenders (August)

slides.title: The Holocaust
bullets: Systematic genocide of 6 million Jews and millions of other minorities by Nazi Germany

slides.title: Outcomes
bullets: United Nations founded (1945)
Cold War begins between US & USSR
Europe divided; Germany occupied
Decolonization in Asia, Africa

slides.title: Key Leaders
bullets: Allies: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Winston Churchill, Joseph Stalin
Axis: Adolf Hitler, Benito Mussolini, Emperor Hirohito

slides.title: Significance
bullets: Deadliest conflict in history (60M+ deaths)
Huge changes in technology, world politics, society
